intro: Xanthophyllum impressum, commonly known as the yellow-flowered saxifrage, is a member of the Polygonaceae family. It is characterized by its bright yellow flowers and distinctive, palmate leaves. Native to alpine regions of Europe, it thrives in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and blooms from June to August. Its unique floral structure and ecological adaptations make it a notable species in mountain ecosystems.
